loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 27 years old and married with one child, who is seven years old. She has been running her retail shop for seven years, earning an income of about 8,000 Kenya shillings a month. Agnes is taking out her first loan with KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy more stock, including flour, detergents, rice and sugar for resale. She hopes to give her child quality education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, 40. She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo, an anime maker, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marites maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these provide income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Marites earns a minimum of Php2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marites hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en: Taha is a 49-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working for 30 years selling fruits and vegetables; it is his only source of income. Taha has been working since he left elementary school, similar to many Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon who do not have enough work experience of education and therefore can not choose the career they may desire. Taha is applying for his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his shop's variety of products with winter fruits and vegetables, especially before the Christmas and New Year's season. He is sure that this loan will increase his income and improve his living conditions and he hopes that he will remain capable of providing for his family.

loans.use: to increase variety of products in his shop with winter fruits and vegetables especially before the Christmas and New Year's season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en: Beglar is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children in a small village of Kareli district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milking cow and 18 sheep. Beglar also owns 2 hectares of agricultural land, where he grows onions and haricots. He sells his harvested products and lamb locally for a good price. Beglar is a very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for cultivating his land and purchasing seeds. After the land is cultivated he will sow seeds and increase the income of his family. With the increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Beglar awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate his land and purchase seeds.

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya is 25 years old and lives in Syunik region with her husband (in the photo). This young family is involved in beekeeping. They keep 15 beehives and get high quality honey. Sofya's husband, Alen, sells the honey in the local markets. 

Alen is a driver in a local company, but his monthly income isn't enough to cover the family's daily costs. So, Sofya has applied for this loan to purchase five colonies of bees. This will help her to get more honey. The family's income will significantly increase and they would be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for five colonies of bees and sell the honey.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is a 37-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for several years now. This is her source of income. Arlene works hard to help her husband meet the needs of their family, especially for the schooling of their children. She is requesting a loan to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, etc. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business and save money to reinvest in her business. Moreover, she hopes to see her children as successful professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, such as flour, sugar, margarine, for resale.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en: Besik is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children in a small village in the Kareli district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a pig, 2 milking cows and 2 calves. They milk cows and produce cheese, which they sell locally in an open market at a good price. Besik also owns 2 hectares of agricultural land, where he grows potatoes. He sells harvested products and cheese locally at a good price. Besik is a very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. He has requested a loan to cultivatr his land and purchase potato seeds. After the land is cultivated, he will sow seeds and increase the income of his family. With the increased income they will improve their living conditions. Besik awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate his land and purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 20, is determined and hard working. She lives with her friend in West Point. Esther completed high school. She has a table in her community where she has been selling oranges, plums, bananas, and cucumbers for the past three years. She loves this business because the daily income she receives is high. She sells from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She transports her goods to her business by commercial vehicle. She thanks her lenders for empowering her in her business. With the loan, she will purchase more oranges, plums, and cucumbers for her business. Her plan is to continue her education and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more oranges, plums, and cucumbers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: John  D.

texts.en: John D. lives in Ground Bassa County, which is a productive county when it comes to fishing and planting rubber, especially the lower part (Compound #3). He is 37 years old, a high school graduate, and has been managing his business since 2006. He has been successful with his business, which has enabled him to buy a piece of land and build a shop. Since his demand is increasing, he is requesting a loan to buy more fashionable clothes, rice by the bag, soft drinks by the crate, Argo-oil by the gallon, etc. to meet his customer's demands. His passion has increased over the years because his shop is the shopping place for the people of Compound #3. His customers really appreciate his business, because the distance from the capital city of Ground Bassa County to Compound #3 is about 77 km long. His belief is that hard work will bring success. He has two children, and they are three and six years old.  They are in school and live with him. He adopted his beliefs and business management skills from his parents. In the near future, he would like to see his children graduate from college and manage their own businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fashionable clothes, rice by the bag, soft drinks by the crate, Argo-oil by the gallon, etc. to meet his customer's demands

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 47-year-old hard working woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, three sons and a daughter. All of her children are married. Her husband has been running a rental car business. Since 2005, Parveen has been running her own jewelry shop for seven years. She is interested  in purchasing some jewelry material for the shop like silver rings, bangles etc.

For that reason, as a member of a six-person lending group, she has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. She is very thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

Note: In the picture, Parveen holds a passbook in her hand and one borrower named Sadaf holds her baby.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for the shop like silver rings, bangles etc.

loans.name: Nabingo Tega Devt Group

texts.en: Alice, a member of the group, is a 30-year-old woman who operates a retail shop in Kyengera village. She began this business because she wanted to raise money to pay school fees for her children. She has two children who are both in school. Her main challenges include bad debtors, price fluctuations, and competition at her village. She would like to expand her business to get more income to support her children and meet their school fee requirements. Being in a group has increased the number of customers she has since they love supporting each other. She is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy daily household items for her retail shop

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, a 51-year-old hard working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and three daughters. Her husband works in a school as a cleaner. One son works at a service station. One daughter is a schoolteacher.

Parveen herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine and some tailoring materials like threads, needles etc. 

Parveen is a member of a three-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase needed items so that she can satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally and efficiently. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. 

Note: In the picture, Parveen holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, threads, needles etc.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en: Husein is a 20-year-old single man who has been working in the aluminum business for four years. He was only 16 years old when he started working to help his family cover their expenses. Husein is working hard to develop himself and start his own business, which is why he is applying for his first youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly released tools for his business. He is well known in the region, with a good reputation and special talent. He hopes to expand his business as much as he can and to increase the number of customers.

loans.use: To buy newly released tools for his business

loans.name: Araik

texts.en:
Araik is a 43-year-old father of two children. He lives in Yerevan town with his wife and two sons.

Araik runs a little store where he trades in fruits and vegetables. Due to his friendly attitude and high-quality service, Araik has gained many loyal clients during one year of running the shop. Araik's elder son Stepan studies at Armenian State Agrarian University, in the department of food economics and management. Unfortunately, Araik's monthly income is only enough to cover the family's basic costs and it is very hard for him to save money for Stepan's education.

Araik has requested this loan to pay for his son's university tuition. This will enable Stepan to continue his education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine runs a farm where she cultivates land and keeps livestock. The farm currently includes seven cows and chickens. She lives with her husband, father-in-law, and two sons. The whole family is engaged in agriculture.

Armine has applied for this loan to purchase three cows and forage for feeding them. Armine and her family live in an old house, which needs to be repaired. The stable growth of agriculture is important for the family to make savings, renovate the house, and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for three cows and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 36 years old. He lives with his mother, wife, and two sons in the small village of Kareli district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell produced cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Vakhtang also owns an agricultural land, where onion and haricot are grown. He sells harvested products locally at a good price.

Vakhtang is very hard working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for cultivating the land and purchasing seeds of onion. After the land is cultivated, he will sow seeds and increase the income of the family. With the increased income they will improve their living conditions. Vakhtang awaits your support.

loans.use: for cultivating his land and purchasing seeds.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 60 years old. He lives with his wife in the small village of Kareli district. Merab is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, he owns an agricultural land, where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. He sells harvested products locally at a good price.

Merab is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for cultivating the land and purchasing fertilizers and seeds of potatoes. After the land is cultivated he will sow seeds and increase the income of the family. With increased income they will improve their living conditions. Merab awaits your support.

loans.use: for cultivating his land and buying fertilizers and seeds of potatoes.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is a farmer from the village of Mokhisi. He is 65 years old and lives with his family: his wife, Tinatin, and his grown son. Tinatin works as a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary. Archil runs the family's agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm and Archil's wife sells the dairy products at the local market. Archil and his family also own an agricultural land, where they grow various fruits and vegetables. Selling harvested vegetables is another source of income for the family. 

Archil has requested credit to purchase a plot of land. The family will be able to sow more vegetables and produce more harvest, with the consequence that the family's income will increase. Archil plans to reinvest his increased income in the family business in order to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Yerevan town with her husband and two sons. Together with her husband she trades in fruits and vegetables in local market. Their income is enough to cover family's basic costs.

Ruzanna's elder son Harutyun studies at Armenian State Agrarian University in the department of Agricultural Policy and Regional Development. It is very difficult for Ruzanna and her husband to sustain the family and also save money for Harutyun's education, so Ruzanna has applied for this loan to pay for her son's university tuition.

The loan is very important for Ruzanna and her family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Kwadjo

texts.en:
Kwadjo sells hardware items such as touch-lights and lanterns in Hohoe Township. He has been in this business for the past seven years, since he was a child. He had no one to take care of him when he started, so he had to be responsible for supporting himself, and he still is. Kwadjo has received an education up to junior high school. He is young and as yet unmarried. 

Kwadjo's loan will be used to purchase more hardware goods like touch-lights and lanterns and to expand his business. He plans to use his new profits from his business to add to his savings, which will enable him to continue his education.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like touch-lights, lanterns and others

loans.name: Theresa T. S.

texts.en:
Theresa T. S. runs a shop in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa county, which is good at production when it comes to fishing. She runs her shop on the Liberia market, where she sells lots of items like used clothes, cosmetics, soft drinks, and batteries. She started this business with help from her sister, and learned the trade from her mother. Presently the problems she faces are the size of her shop and low income.

Theresa is requesting a loan to buy more goods (such as used clothes, cosmetics, soft drinks, and batteries) and to expand the size of her business. She enjoys her business because it has improved her life and her childrens' lives.

Theresa is a high school graduate, is 37 years old, and is married with four children ages 5, 9, 11 and 12. All of her children are in school and living with her. Her dreams are to expand her business even more, and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods, such as used clothes, cosmetics, soft drinks, and batteries, and to expand the size of her business.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is 30 years old. He lives with his parents, wife, and an infant daughter in the small village of Kareli district. Bagrat is involved in an agricultural business. In particular he has two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. He sells produced cheese locally in an open market at a good price. He also owns an agricultural land, where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. He sells harvested products locally at a good price. 

Bagrat is very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for cultivating the land and purchasing fertilizers and seeds of potatoes. After the land is cultivated he will sow seeds and increase the income of the family. With increased income they will improve their living conditions. Bagrat awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate his land, and to purchase fertilizers and seeds of potatoes.

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en:
Heriknaz is a chemist at a local factory in Yerevan, where she lives with her husband and two children. Her daughter Ani studies at Gladzor University in Yerevan, in the department of Foreign Languages. 

Heriknaz's husband receives a retirement pension and her elder son works out of the country, providing financial assistance to his family. However, it is very difficult for the family to save money for Ani's education. Therefore, Heriknaz has applied for this loan in order to pay for her daughter’s university tuition. 

This will enable Ani to continue her studying and become a skilled specialist.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie has been running a shop where she sells many items like fashion clothes, ladies' handbags, and fabric in the area of Buchanan. She lives with her three children and husband, who is a businessman also.

She said that she is very happy with her business for so many reasons. She emphasizes how supportive her business is to her family and relatives. She was able to buy a piece of land on which to build her house, and to attend to her childrens' schooling. She started this business in 2006 by selling fish since her husband was very good at fishing.

Mamie is a high school graduate and 37 years old. Her dream is to see herself as an international businesswoman and educate her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more items like fashion clothes, ladies' handbags, and fabric to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like fashion clothes, ladies' handbags, and fabric to improve her business.

loans.name: Salifu

texts.en:
Salifu sells detergent at Hohoe lorry station. Salifu has received education to Senior High School level. He is single.

Salifu has been selling detergents for the past six years. He is responsible for catering for his extended family. He would like to use his loan to introduce a new business of selling toothpaste and sponges, since he realized that there are demands for these products. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to open a big shop.

loans.use: to introduce a new business: the selling of toothpaste and sponges.

loans.name: J.israel

texts.en:
J. Israel lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa Count, which is noted for producing fish on the Liberia Market. He is 36 years old, is married, and has four children between the ages of  6 and 16 who are in school and living with him.

J.Israel has been running a shop since 2007, where he sews and sells school uniforms and African suits. He started this business with a little money given to him by his sister, and learned this way of selling from his friends. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more tailoring materials and cloth for his business. He enjoys how his business makes him popular and he makes more profit especially during school and Christmas season. The problem that he faces is small commodities. Because he has more customers, he plans to expand his business even more and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials and cloth for his business.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 39 years old. He lives with his wife, three children, and mother-in-law in the small village of Lanchkhuti. His mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. His children go to local school.

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 6 hectares of land, where maize and 100 nut trees are grown. In addition, they have two milk cows.

Tengiz is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing calves, he will increase the livestock and therefore the income of the family will increase. With increased income they will expand the cattle in future. Tengiz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Conileus

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Cornelius. He is married and has two children, ages 3 and 24 yrs. In 2006, he established his Entertainment Center, showing football matches and providing bar services. He began his business because he was out of a job. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, Cornelius earns about 1,600,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Cornelius requires this loan in order to buy more drinks. He plans to improve more on this business and educate his children well. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is married and has four children. He had no formal education. Robert sells secondhand clothes in Hohoe market, which he has done for four years to support his family. His wife is a petty trader.

Robert uses his income to pays his childrens' school fees. Robert will use the loan to purchase and introduce the selling of mens' shirts into his business. With the new profits from his loan, he hopes to save for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase and introduce the selling of mens' shirts into his business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, además de  decidida. Es conviviente con Kevin quien trabaja como empleado y es padre de sus 3 hijos: Kein de 9 años, Arison de 03 años y Adriana de 4 meses de nacida.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus  hijos a los que adora y son el motivo de querer  progresar, habitando su casa propia, la cual logró construir en conjunto con su pareja. La actividad que realiza Nilda  es la venta de comestibles y abarrotes en general, para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña bodega que logro acondicionar en su propia casa, viendo las necesidades de sus vecinos de adquirir sus productos en un lugar más cercano y no tener que desplazarse muy lejos para poder comprar. Todos sus productos son adquiridos en los centros comerciales de la ciudad y los vende en la tienda en su casa.
Lleva funcionando hace más de 01año, tiempo con el cual logró hacerse conocida entre sus vecinos y ganarse así una regular clientela, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con la ayuda de su pareja en la atención al público en sus ratos libres.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la ganancias que le deja, pues mantiene una regular clientela que siempre le compran sus productos.
Le gusta su actividad  poder estar  en casa  para poder ver y atender a sus menores hijos, éste fue el principal motivo por el cual se decidió a abrir una bodega en casa, ya que anteriormente trabajo en un puesto de ventas en el mercado.  
Por tanto, tiene planes de  hacer incrementar el stock de sus productos y abrir paralelo ese negocio una fuente de soda. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad brindada de poder contar con un capital de trabajo, desea  seguir contando con éste apoyo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus  pagos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan mutuamente
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará  más variedad de comestibles y abarrotes buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa podrá ser más competitivo en relación a precios  y aumentar el stock de mercadería disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Nilda is 31 years old, and an enterprising and hard-working woman, and decisive too.  She lives with Kevin who works as an employee, and who is father of her 3 children; Kein, who is 9 years old, Arison, 3, and Adriana, who is 4 months.  She lives with her partner and children, whom she adores, and who are the reason that she wants to get on in life. They live in their own house, which Nilda managed to build with her partner. Nilda’s business is the sale of foodstuffs and general groceries, which she sells from a little shop that she was able to fit out in her own house. Nilda recognised her neighbours’ necessity to be able to get the things that they needed somewhere closer, without having to travel great distances to do their shopping. Nilda buys all her products in the shopping centres in the city and sells them in the shop in her house.
Her shop has been open for more than a year now, during which time she has managed to make herself known in the neighbourhood and build up a regular clientele. Up until now, she has been able to put all of this into effect with the help of her partner, who serves customers in his spare moments.
Linda considers her business to be quite worthwhile because of the profits that it provides, as she has regular customers who always buy her products.
She likes her business because it means that she can stay at home to look after her small children. This was the main reason for her decision to open a shop at home, because before, she worked on a market stall.  
However, she has plans to increase her stock of products and to run parallel to this business, a soda fountain.  Therefore, this will be loan number 3 with the institution MFP. She feels pleased with the opportunity offered to her; to be able to count on working capital. She wants to be able to continue to rely on this support, and for this reason, she promises to be punctual with the payments. Apart from this, she feels comfortable with the community bank because of the mutual support that they offer each other.
With the amount of 1000 New Soles, which she is applying for, Nilda intends to buy a greater variety of foods and groceries, looking to get better prices by buying in bulk. In this way, she can be more competitive in her pricing, and increase the stock available for sale.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah 37, stopped her education in the fifth grade. She is married with two lovely children, ages 7 and 10. They stay at home with their mother at Sinkor and are currently in school. She has been involved in the sales of used clothing for the past five years. She sells both boys' and girls' clothing. She sells 12 hours a day and makes profit when she sells, especially during the Christmas season. She transports her goods by commercial vechile.

She thanks the lenders for the support they are giving to her business. She will use the loan given her to purchase more used clothes for the business and to increase her sales. Her plan is to give her children a higher level of education and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, de 36 años de edad, es un hombre con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Es conviviente con Arita quien es comerciante y madre de sus 03 hijos de 21, 18 y 10 años de edad.  Vive cómodamente en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja y  sus hijos a quienes quiere  mucho y son su motivación. El trabajo de  Cesar  consiste en la reparación de celulares de todas las marcas. Cada mañana a las 05 de la mañana se dirige al mercado número 02 donde tiene un pequeño puesto, donde atiende cordialmente a sus clientes.  Realiza ésta actividad desde hace más de 6 años, contando con el apoyo de un  amigo cuando tiene que hacer varias reparaciones, de esa manera logra entregara tiempo todos los celulares a reparar.
Le gusta su actividad ya que lo mantiene ocupado y le permite ejercer lo que aprendió en un centro de ocupación. Se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio para contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos del su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, además de poder manejar su propio horario de trabajo. Por lo contrario comenta que le incomoda cuando sus clientes no recogen a tiempo los  celulares que mandaron a reparar, tiene que almacenarlos ocupando lugar en su almacén que es muy pequeño. Pero esto no lo desanima y continua trabajando, teniendo planes de seguir en su negocio y crecer. Por tanto éste será el  préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, Esperando de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas para más adelante seguir obteniendo mayores montos. 
Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su totalidad   en la compra de repuestos  a precio al  por mayor, traídos desde la capital, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Cesar, who is 36 years old, is a very experienced business man, apart from being very cheerful and friendly. He lives with Arita, who is a shopkeeper, and mother to his three children, who are 21, 18 and 10 years old. He lives comfortably in his own home, in the company of his partner and children, whom he loves very much, and who are his motivation in life. Cesar works repairing mobile phones of all the different makes. Every morning, at 5 am, he goes to market number 2, where he has a small stand, and where he serves his customers warmly. He has been running this business for more than 6 years. He can count on the help of a friend, when he has a lot of repairs to do, and in this way, he can deliver all of the mobiles on time.
He likes his business because it keeps him busy, and allows him to make use of what he has learnt at training school. He decided upon this business because of the necessity of having a trade, in order to be able to rely upon an income, to cover the costs of his home and the education of his children. Apart from that, he wanted to be able to be in control of his own working hours. On the other hand, Cesar comments that it is very inconvenient when his customers don’t collect the mobile phones, that they have left for repair, on time.  This means that he has to store them, and they take up space in his store, which is very small. But this doesn’t discourage him, and he carries on working, with plans to carry on in this business and to grow. Therefore, this will be loan number 1 with the institution MFP. He is counting on their collaboration, in order to be able to continue with his goals. Cesar promises to pay his installments on time, so as to be able to obtain larger sums in the future. 
With the amount of 600 New Soles, Cesar is going to invest the complete amount in spare parts, at wholesale prices, which he wants to bring from the capital. He is looking to get better prices by buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for mobile phones, at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 40-year-old single man who has been working as a chef in a hotel for a year and a half. He loves his work a lot and enjoys doing it on a daily basis.

Karim's work and home are located in a very rough area during the winter season, especially the transportation over the thick snow.

Because he is dedicated to his job, he is working hard to face any unexpected issue and to keep on coming despite any unexpected circumstances. That's why he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua: to buy a car that will ease his transportation from home to work during the heavy winter season.

He hopes that one day he can open his own restaurant that he could develop into a motel in the future.

loans.use: To buy a car to ease his transportation from home to work during the heavy winter season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a man of forty-three years, married to Mary and a father of five children. He does taxi business in Kangemi and has been doing so for six years now. He earns an income of about thirty-five thousand KES in a month.

This will be Stephens' first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire amount to take his car for servicing and also do minor repairs on the taxi. In future he wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To take the taxi for servicing and repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 26 years old and he supports two of his sisters. He runs a business of selling movie CDs and DVDs and this has been his business for five years where he earns a monthly income of about KES 29,000.

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 50,000 which he intends to use to expand his business by adding more stock of CDs. 

He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To add more stock of CDs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purhcase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a woman of forty-seven years. She is married to Samuel and together they have four beautiful children. Joyce is a dairy and poultry farmer in Kawangware. She has been in this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of about twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Joyce’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy feeds for her cows and poultry and also buy more poultry. In future she wants to be a better businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy poultry and feeds for them and for her cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy batteries for charging.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a thirty-five year old, married to Susan and a father of three children. He sells secondhand shoes and has been doing so for twelve years now, earning a monthly income of about fifty-three thousand shillings.

This will be Elijah’s first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to buy secondhand shoes for resale. In future he wants to open a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que no le teme  a los retos contando con mucha experiencia en los negocios. Es Conviviente de Gustavo quien es comerciante y padre de sus 02  hijos de 21 y 08 años. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa. El trabajo que realiza Lupe  es la venta de pescado fresco por las mañanas que compra en el puerto pesquero de la localidad.  La venta la realiza de manera ambulatoria contando con un triciclo acondicionado con un parlante para ofertar su producto,  lo usa de transporte, para llevar sus productos por las calles de los asentamientos humanos y pueblos jóvenes. También cuenta con un mototaxi que lo alquila a un chofer cobrando un promedio de 25 nuevos soles diarios,  generándose un ingreso adicional.
Se inicio hace más de 03 años con este negocio, contando con un capital propio y luego fue aumentando con préstamos, contando con el apoyo de su conviviente en la venta.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, ya que generalmente logra acabar todo lo que lleva para vender. 
Comenta, se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio pues no cuenta con una profesión, y así  tener los ingresos necesarios para solventar los estudios de sus hijos, logrando educarlos siendo esa la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar, además de  considerarlo más rentable que su anterior oficio, viendo sus ganancias a diario.
Por tanto,  viendo sus buenos resultados, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerse. Por  tanto éste será el préstamo número 01  con la institución MFP, espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además  de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de pescado en mayor volumen y en la reparación de su  motokart.
texts.en:
Lupe, age 43, is a hardworking and determined woman who is not afraid of challenges.  She also has a lot of experience in business.  She lives with her partner, Gustavo, who works as a merchant, and their two children, ages 8 and 21.  Together they all live comfortably in their own home.

Lupe’s business is selling fresh fish in the mornings that she buys from her city’s fishing port.  She sells the fish as a travelling vendor using a tricycle equipped with a loudspeaker, which she uses to offer her products.  She uses the tricycle to transport her products through the streets of the settlements and new towns.  She also has a mototaxi that she rents to a driver for an average of 25 nuevos soles per day, in this way generating some additional income.

Lupe began her business more than three years ago with some of her own capital and then gradually expanded it with the help of loans.  Her partner also helps her with her sales.

Her business generates profits for her as she generally sells everything she carries with her to sell.

She says that she decided to start her business because she needed a trade, since she does not have a profession.  She needs the money she earns from her business to pay for the education of her children, which she believes is the best inheritance she can leave them.  Moreover, compared to her previous work, her business earns her more profit each day.

Therefore, given her positive results, she would like to continue earning a living with her business.  This will be her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and with their assistance she hopes to further her goals.  Moreover, she says she is happy with her communal bank because they are a committed and united team.

Lupe will use the requested 600 nuevos soles to buy fish in larger quantities and to repair her motocart.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish in larger quantities and to repair her motocart.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a woman of thirty-two years. She is married to Hillary and they have two children. Her husband does not have a well-paying job, so she is the main bread winner. She has a boutique in Nairobi town. She has been in the business for one year now and she gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase jeans, tops and bags for sale. She plans to use the profits to expand her business. 

In future, she wants to open another boutique in town.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorgum

loans.name: Kitumbo Group

texts.en:
Erick, who is in his early 30s, is married with three children. One of his children goes to school while the other two are still young.  

Erick has operated a barber shop for six years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy two good shaving machines and pay for household expenses. He has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for another loan to buy another salon chair and more shaving machines. His dream is to one day own a furniture-selling business.

Erick will share this loan with his loan group "Kitumbo," which includes 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another salon chair and more shaving machines.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 41-year-old lady from the city of Kisumu. She is married to Abdul and they have two children who are 20 and 15 years old respectively.

Esther operates a retail shop where she sells soft drinks and mineral water to her customers. She has been doing this business for the last six years, and she earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more mineral water and soft drinks for sale. She hopes to increase her business profits with the added inventory the loan will provide.

She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more mineral water and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
From the city of Kisumu, Beatrice, a 39-year-old woman married to Gordon, is the mother of two children and guardian to one nephew. Beatrice sells second-hand clothes, and retails fresh juice as a secondary enterprise. In business for the last five years, her monthly profit is Kes 60,000.

Beatrice is requesting her second loan with KADET LTD to buy more stock for her clothing business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and buy food for the family.

Beatrice hopes to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Daisy Esperanza

texts.es:
Daisy Esperanza, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Daisy, tiene más de 10 años de tener este negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. En su comunidad tiene establecidos sus clientes, ella trabaja muy duro todo el día. De este negocio ella ha podido sostener a su familia ya que no recibe ayuda económica del padre de sus hijos y con la venta de tortillas obtiene los ingresos que necesita.
Ya ha solicitado cinco prestamos a ODEF, con este que solicita actualmente que es por 12,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar los insumos como la harina de maíz  y leña para hacer las tortillas y vender, y con una parte del préstamo va comprar un relleno para el patio de su casa para evitar se llene de agua cuando llueve.
Su meta es mantener este negocio de donde sacar ingresos para que sus hijos estudien y tengan un hogar digno. Agradece mucho a ODEF y a Kiva por el apoyo financiero brindado.
texts.en:
Daisy Esperanza, age 43, is a single mother with three children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Doña Daisy has been making and selling corn tortillas for more than 10 years. She has established customers in her community and works very hard each day. Her business enables her to support her family since she does not receive financial assistance from the father of her children. By selling tortillas, she is able to generate the income she needs.

Daisy has already requested five loans from ODEF. Her current loan is for 12,000 HNL and the money will be used to buy supplies, such as cornmeal and firewood, for making tortillas that she can sell. Part of the loan will be used to buy filler material for the patio of her house to prevent puddles from forming when it rains.

Her goal is to maintain this business so that she will have income to pay for her children’s studies and to provide them a decent home. She is very grateful to ODEF and to Kiva for the financial support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making tortillas and to acquire filler material for fixing her patio.
